author: juderm
body: I have a "space" watchlist that includes: SPCE, GRMN, TDY, BA, HON, MAXR, HXL

author: hamingo
body:
$MAXR for sure, they have a very bright future.  


$TDY for novel infrared camera tech. now is a good time to get in for a 2-5 year hold.  


I'm not sure about $NOC. NASA has been paying them to work on ion thrusters for the past couple of years & they've been hiring like crazy, yet the stock price has slid downhill since they bought out Orbital ATK in 2018.  


The usual big boys who swallow up the most promising startups will be in there: $LMT, $BA, $LDOS, $RTX

author: TeslaMillionaire
body: Teledyne also makes other space equipment, like the nuclear power sources for satellites and the mars rovers.

author: dafurball
body: Once the deal is finalized the stocks are automatically converted and your account is credited. $56 is the cost for the company to buy FLIR from you. Half of the $56 is converted to cash while the other half is converted to TDY shares.  If your broker doesn't support fractional shares then you will be credited the cash value instead.

author: dafurball
body: The conversion occurs when the deal between TDY and BB is finalized - it does not trigger base on price. You don't have anything to lose if you sell now. The only benefit of holding is to get TDY shares.

author: dafurball
body: For an example if you have 50 FLIR stocks you can sell now at $54 for a total of $2,700. You can also wait a few months to sell at $56 a share for a total of $2,800. Because you only have 50 shares and E-trade does not support fractional shares you would be automatically cashed out if you waited. If you had 57 shares you would be given 1 TDY share and $1,596 in cash. TDY is currently valued at $387.

author: DanBaileysBigToe
body:
Thanks. It makes a bit more sense now. One more question would be about the "if I waited" part. Do you mean if I waited for FLIR to hit $56 and at that point my shares would be converted to TDY?    
I currently own 104 shares of FLIR. I Don't really have a desire to own TDY. So my question would be would it hurt me to sell FLIR now? Or is there a good reason to wait for it to hit $56? From what I gather if I have no desire to own TDY selling FLIR now isn't a bad decision.
